alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 6:31PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cameron County through 715 PM CST... At 629 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a cold front over San Benito extending southwest to La Paloma, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... San Benito, Rancho Viejo, Los Indios, Southmost, Olmito, La Paloma, Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Brownsville and Lincoln Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 1 and 22. US Highway 281 between mile markers 820 and 838. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
